title: Are superstitious things actually true? - Quora

response.answer_text: Superstition is a pejorative term for any belief or practice that is considered irrational: for example, if it arises from ignorance, a misunderstanding of science or causality, a positive belief in fate or magic, or fear of that which is unknown. "Superstition" also refers to actions arising from irrationality. Superstitious things are unsupported, irrational and often derived from fear. It is possible their are some truths to them or eventually some may be found as true, but in general they are not. Just like rumors or gossip, folklore or urban legends, they may start with a portion of truth but after repeated, exaggerated, edited and given am extra boost, they take on a life of their own often hardly resembling their original version.

Which superstitious belief? I mean, superstitious beliefs are, by definition, entirely lacking in objective evidence, so there isn’t a single one that is compelling. However, it is best to be specific when asking a question like this as it makes it easier to give you a satisfactory answer. If you had given me a specific one, I could have told you why that one is nonsense, for example.
